title: Serviced Apartment News Launches Industry Awards Scheme
text:
Serviced Apartment News
LONDON , September 11, 2015 /PRNewswire/ --
Serviced Apartment News, the only dedicated b2b news resource for the serviced apartment, aparthotel and extended stay sectors, is delighted to announce it is launching the Serviced Apartment News Awards.
The inaugural awards will take place at a ceremony at a 5 star location in London , in March 2016 .
The awards will include categories for properties, operators, service providers, agents, marketing campaigns, innovation and individuals.
The awards will be judged by a panel of industry experts - with all shortlisted developments being visited by judges. One category - the Industry Inspiration award, for the individual who has done the most to inspire the sector - will be voted for by Serviced Apartment News readers.
Entries for the awards are free of charge and can be submitted from November 2015 onwards.
Piers Brown , CEO of International Hospitality Media, the parent company of Serviced Apartment News, said: "We're very excited about launching the awards, which will be a great way of rewarding best practice in our industry, raising awareness of the exciting developments, innovative companies and dynamic individuals who make the serviced apartment and extended stay sector such a vibrant arena to work in."
There has already been a hugely positive response to the awards from the industry.
Jan Jacobsen , Global Project Manager, Travel, Meetings & Events, AIG said: "The inaugural Serviced Apartment News Awards are a great initiative for the serviced apartment, aparthotel and extended stay sectors to reward best practice. The event promises to be a super opportunity to recognise and celebrate the achievements of the industry's leading businesses, teams and individuals who have performed outstandingly in their chosen field over the last 12 months."
Andrew Fowler , director of Urban Villa , said: "It's super news that the inaugural Serviced Apartment News Awards' will be a standalone event. Putting the spotlight on the individuals and businesses, and rewarding best in class achievements, will help drive the serviced apartment, aparthotel and extended stay sectors' quality standards and awareness. That's great news for all of us."
Ricky Kapoor , commercial director of The Edinburgh Collection and Holyrood Aparthotel, said: "It's great to see our industry celebrating best practice with the first standalone awards evening. This gives the sector more recognition within the wider hospitality industry and collectively drives us forward. Serviced Apartment News should have done it sooner!"
Naveen Ahmed , owner, Roomzzz Apartment Hotels, said: "Roomzzz will definitely be entering the awards. I'm delighted Serviced Apartment News has taken the initiative for our sector, see you in March 2016 ."
